Acquisition: Life Cycle Cost
   
  Cost Impacts of Change

Lastly, it is important to understand that changes can be made to the system anytime throughout its life cycle. But as the system matures it becomes significantly more expensive to change its design.

For example, if all factors were considered in the design effort, then the relative cost would be $1.

If the subsequent changes need to be made concerning logistics factors that were not designed into the initial design effort and were done in the developmental phase of the life cycle, the cost raises to a cost of $10.

If these changes are made during the production life cycle phase, the cost delta is raised to $100 to effect the change.

 

  

 

Then heaven forbid, if a logistics consideration needs to be engineered into the system when it has already been deployed in the field, the cost is raised to a factor of $1000.
